sub_title: President of Wittenborg; the Most International Business School in the Netherlands
summary:
Peter Birdsall is President of the Board of Wittenborg University of Applied Sciences in Apeldoorn. He is passionate about quality higher education in the Netherlands, that is inclusive, diverse and embraces internationalisation. 

WUAS is a business school, with around 1400 students (2022) and 200+ employed and affiliated staff in 2022, totally representing more than 120 nationalities. WUAS' growth is around 15% per year and it is the most international independent privately funded higher education institute in the Netherlands. The school aims to become the top ranked Dutch university of applied sciences in the field of international management and sustainable business development.

WUAS aims to develop to the level of a so-called ‘boutique’ university; that is to say, a university that maintains a constant student body of around 1,500 high-quality students, and maintains a national degree-awarding power and can develop and sustain multiple international accreditations, staff development, an applied sciences research profile, and an international profile. WUAS’ goal is to develop into a broad business and management-orientated university of applied sciences in various professional fields, such as Business & Entrepreneurship, Hospitality & Tourism, Arts & Technology, Health & Social Care, and Education. 

Together with his wife, Maggie Feng, WUAS' CEO, Peter has embarked upon a journey of continuous development & improvement for the university, steering it towards a path of responsible management & social responsibility both locally and nationally. With a commitment to life-long learning, sustainable management, diversity, internationalisation & ethical practice, Peter continues to invest in WUAS' future.

Peter’s career started at the age of 16 when he started a Theatre Company, & has seen him involved in concerns that have activities such as running a bar, a restaurant, a cleaning company, importing furniture, China consultancy, website design, as well as various training initiatives.

Peter has also (once) been 'properly' employed, at a state University of Applied Sciences in the Netherlands - between 1996 and 2002, with an aim to bring international education to the institute, which succeeded, but also sowed the seeds for the Wittenborg (ad)venture. : -)

profile_positions.title: President

profile_positions.description:
Together with Maggie Feng, Peter is a member of the Executive Board of Wittenborg University of Applied Sciences - a 'boutique' state appointed, & state accredited University of Applied Sciences in the central Netherlands.

"I have been responsible for guiding our university through various accreditations, essential for our existence & growth. This includes our international, English taught, bachelor's programmes that were started in 2006, and have gone through three full cycles of accreditation, & even received the European ECA accreditation for internationalisation. In 2015 we gained our first bespoke Master accreditation when our MBA was accredited by FIBAA and later in 2016 by NVAO. The MBA now has 11 different graduation specialisations and we have over 200 MBA students studying at present. In 2020 we gained NVAO accreditation for our Master of Business Management programmes as a Master of Science (MSc), with 9 specialisations, and around 150 students are enrolled in the programmes. 

During the past 15 years at Wittenborg, I have learned much about accounting, finance, ICT projects, higher education law-making, politics, lobby, HRM, & above all about the milestones that a growing organisation goes through. Since 2010, we have grown from under 200 students representing around 20 nationalities to just over 1200 representing 100. Our faculty and professional staff have quadrupled, as have the budgets. We have carried out interesting EU and national research projects and are engaged in new ones. We have refined our strategies, our positioning, and increased our stakeholders at a local, national & international level. We have developed a strategic plan, which is to lead us through the exciting developments in 2022-2026 and beyond. We have placed our strategy and thus the organization on our three main pillars: internationalization, diversity & ethics.”
profile_positions.title: Chair of the Executive Board

profile_positions.description: The WUAS Foundation oversaw the development of Wittenborg in the period from its transition from the Dutch "Hogeschool Wittenborg" to the English speaking "Wittenborg University of Applied Sciences" that took place between 2007 and 2010. After Wittenborg moved its campus location from the city of Deventer to Apeldoorn, in the summer of 2010, it was decided to divide the governance of the University into two separate foundations. The original foundation became the still independent Wittenborg University of Applied Sciences Advisory Board, and currently consists of 6 independent members. The directors of WUAS were brought into the Wittenborg University of Applied Sciences Executive. This change has achieved a greater level of corporate governance required at this privately funded institution that fulfills a semi-public role.
profile_positions.title: Member of the Board - Wittenborg University of Applied Sciences (WUAS) Foundation

profile_positions.description:
Director of International Studies at the Wittenborg University of Applied Sciences (www.wittenborg.eu), with Business School Bachelor programmes in Deventer, the Netherlands. At this time, programmes were offered in Dutch as well as English. The numbers of Dutch students were around 150 on average during a year and were matched by the same number of international students, mainly from China, Vietnam and South East Asia. At that time, the main programme was a broad Bachelor in International Business Administration, specialising in in Banking and Insurance, Hospitality and Tourism, Small Business, Real Estate and Marketing & Communication. In 2007 Wittenborg decided to gradually close the Dutch programmes (Real Estate Management, Banking & Insurance, and Communication Management) and concentrate on building its international programmes and developing a true international classroom.

Peter developed the use of the e-learning platform based on Moodle, (www.wittenborg-online.com) that is still central to Wittenborg's curriculum and teaching management.

His responsibilities / portfolio at this time included: Financial Management, Personnel, Curriculum Management, and Information (also Technology) Management

In 2006, Peter led the organisation through its first full accreditation by NVAO, instigated as a result of the introduction of the European Bachelor / Master structure (Bologna) and a new accretion requirement as part of the Act of Higher Education. It was this process that paved the way to the fundamental changes at Wittenborg which resulted in the English speaking and international business school it is today.
profile_positions.title: Director of International Studies

profile_positions.description:
As a side business Peter has been involved in the production and publication of two books written by his nephew, the writer and artist Ben Birdsall.

'Whisky Burn' - Distilleries of Scotland by Vespa - the Highlands and Islands

Whisky Burn is a book that will appeal to Scotch experts and novices alike.  Read it as an amusing and at times fascinating travel narrative, a useful reference book, or an invaluable guide to distilleries. Whisky Burn is the story of a journey - one man, one Vespa, one thousand miles (1,600km), a lot of distilleries, and a fair amount of rain.

Whiskey Burn -The Distilleries of Ireland by Vespa

1,600 km, 21 days, 1 man and his Vespa, and a fair bit of rain. Ben takes us on his second "painting" trip, this time around the Irish distilleries. The distilling landscape of Ireland has changed dramatically over the last five years with the resurgence of Irish whiskey, with dozens of distilleries being built and planned. Join Ben as he discovers the old, the new, and the yet-to-come distilleries of Ireland in Whiskey Burn.

Both books are published by Wittenborg University Press, Apeldoorn. see: http://www.whiskyburn.com
profile_positions.title: Publisher 'Whisky Burn' (2015) & 'Whiskey Burn' (2018)

profile_positions.description:
Birdsalls Limited was a family organization, although the company has been disbanded, due to the work being carried out independently by BTC in Austria and Wittenborg University in the Netherlands. 

Birdsalls Limited in 2010: "We are “educationalists”. Our business is learning, training, development, personal growth, qualification. Birdsalls has its roots in the UK, Switzerland and China and currently manages its projects from its base in Austria and the Netherlands.
Birdsalls manages a number of brands. Most are fully functioning business which have kept us and our partners in business for 20 years and counting. Others are ideas in progress. The brand focus also represents the way in which our business grows and develops. Many of these brands have recently been brought under WiNet – the Wittenborg University Network, with an aim to introduce business students to the concept of a Brand Incubator."
profile_positions.title: Partner

profile_positions.description: Hogeschool IJselland was a great medium sized University of Professional Education and supported a small but dynamic and innovative business school. Later, it merged with some school in Enschede, to the East, and it is now called Saxion Universities of Applied Sciences, which is different. In my day it encountered a classic China meets the rest of the world business situation. Worth a book at retirement :-)
profile_positions.title: Director International Office

profile_positions.description: Freelance business case writer for KPMG's Business Performance Improvement department in Deventer, the Netherlands. During this time I was fortunate enough to work with many systems designers and this experience helped me develop skills and knowledge of using Linux systems and early CMS based website systems to manage data. I learnt enough to know that I need to continue learning : -) and even until today (2015) manage a number of complex Linux systems that host a number of complex web-based open source applications.
profile_positions.title: Consultant (Freelance)

profile_positions.description: Lecturer and International Education developer at what was then the "Best University of Professional Education (Hogechool)" in the Netherlands, as voted for by students.
profile_positions.title: International Education Developer and Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
During this time Peter worked sometimes and ran businesses sometimes. Experiences in the UK (fatherland), Switzerland (motherland) and the Netherlands (adopted land) include:
Being a social worker for the elderly in Eastbourne (10 months)
Helping manage a British Pub at an international hotel in Olten, Switzerland (1.5 years)
Helping set-up and run a successful Italian restaurant in Arnhem, the Netherlands (3 years)
Running a green-concept cleaning company in the Netherlands, (in 1991 - lasted 1/2 year due to lack of interest :-)..) HaHa!
Single Parent (7 Years) - Peter became a single parent in 1992, caring for his baby daughter, Samantha, whilst returning to study in higher education at Windesheim UAS (Zwolle), in pursuit of a career in education.
profile_positions.title: Employee and Entrepreneur

company.name: Tivoli Theatre and Performing Arts Centre Eastbourne

profile_positions.company: Tivoli Theatre and Performing Arts Centre Eastbourne
profile_positions.description: Helping to set up and run the pioneering Tivoli Performing Arts Centre in Eastbourne was one of the most thrilling and useful experiences of my early career. Thanks to the Brewer family for making it all possible. This experience caused the eventual creation of the Birdsalls (un)Limited concept and ensured that both Birdsall brothers became "unemployable" and enabled us to map out the career pathways we have chosen...
profile_positions.title: the Apprentice

profile_positions.description:
This is where it all started. I dropped out of my A levels, and started my career as an entrepreneur. Learned who we were, and who we weren't. Learned who to vote for and who we didn't. It took a bit of time to learn where we were going though, and some of us are still learning :-) We produced plays and cabaret in Eastbourne and toured the south east of England.
•	Accidental Death of an Anarchist #1 (1983)
•	Androcles and the Lion (1984)
•	Can’t Pay Won’t Pay (1984 – 1985)
•	The Importance of Being Ernest (1985)
•	Accidental Death of an Anarchist #2 (1985)
•	Tickling Pink  Alternative Cabaret (1984 – 1986)
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder
